description: Production-representative temporal-star vault. 50% daily notes, skewed entity distribution, short codes, habit hubs, high orphan rate.

notes.content:
## Habits
- Wrote in my Journaling notebook
- Exercise at the gym this evening
- Did my morning [[Stretch]] routine
- Drank plenty of Water today

## Work
Sarah Kim flagged an incident in MobileApp. Quick React fix applied.
Paired with David Chen on ESGHub Docker refactoring.
Carlos Rivera and I discussed the Microservices approach for UserOnboarding.
Ran chaos engineering on PaymentProcessor before the stg deployment.

notes.title: Meeting Notes 1
notes.content:
# Meeting: DevPortal

Attendees: Sarah Kim, David Chen

## Discussion
Discussed progress on DevPortal. The team is evaluating GraphQL for the backend migration.

Sarah Kim raised concerns about the Clean Architecture approach.
David Chen confirmed the timeline aligns with the sprint goals.

## Action Items
- Sarah Kim to prototype GraphQL integration
- Review Staging requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 2
notes.content:
# Meeting: MobileApp

Attendees: David Chen, Sarah Kim

## Discussion
Discussed progress on MobileApp. The team is evaluating Node.js for the backend migration.

David Chen raised concerns about the DevOps approach.
Sarah Kim confirmed the timeline aligns with the on-call goals.

## Action Items
- David Chen to prototype Node.js integration
- Review UAT requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 3
notes.content:
# Meeting: MobileApp

Attendees: Elena Torres, Marcus Johnson

## Discussion
Discussed progress on MobileApp. The team is evaluating Python for the backend migration.

Elena Torres raised concerns about the API-First approach.
Marcus Johnson confirmed the timeline aligns with the canary release goals.

## Action Items
- Elena Torres to prototype Python integration
- Review JWT requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 4
notes.content:
# Meeting: DevPortal

Attendees: Aisha Patel, David Chen

## Discussion
Discussed progress on DevPortal. The team is evaluating Node.js for the backend migration.

Aisha Patel raised concerns about the Clean Architecture approach.
David Chen confirmed the timeline aligns with the backlog goals.

## Action Items
- Aisha Patel to prototype Node.js integration
- Review JWT requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 5
notes.content:
# Meeting: TeamDashboard

Attendees: Lisa Wong, David Chen

## Discussion
Discussed progress on TeamDashboard. The team is evaluating React for the backend migration.

Lisa Wong raised concerns about the API-First approach.
David Chen confirmed the timeline aligns with the planning goals.

## Action Items
- Lisa Wong to prototype React integration
- Review RAG requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 6
notes.content:
# Meeting: UserOnboarding

Attendees: Marcus Johnson, Carlos Rivera

## Discussion
Discussed progress on UserOnboarding. The team is evaluating Redis for the backend migration.

Marcus Johnson raised concerns about the Clean Architecture approach.
Carlos Rivera confirmed the timeline aligns with the feature flag goals.

## Action Items
- Marcus Johnson to prototype Redis integration
- Review UAT requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 7
notes.content:
# Meeting: CloudMigration

Attendees: Lisa Wong, Carlos Rivera

## Discussion
Discussed progress on CloudMigration. The team is evaluating TypeScript for the backend migration.

Lisa Wong raised concerns about the API-First approach.
Carlos Rivera confirmed the timeline aligns with the architecture decision goals.

## Action Items
- Lisa Wong to prototype TypeScript integration
- Review SDK requirements

notes.title: Meeting Notes 8
notes.content:
# Meeting: SearchEngine

Attendees: Marcus Johnson, David Chen

## Discussion
Discussed progress on SearchEngine. The team is evaluating Kubernetes for the backend migration.

Marcus Johnson raised concerns about the Microservices approach.
David Chen confirmed the timeline aligns with the chaos engineering goals.

## Action Items
- Marcus Johnson to prototype Kubernetes integration
- Review Production requirements

notes.content:
# Meeting: ESGHub

Attendees: James Franklin, Elena Torres

## Discussion
Discussed progress on ESGHub. The team is evaluating Node.js for the backend migration.

James Franklin raised concerns about the DevOps approach.
Elena Torres confirmed the timeline aligns with the documentation goals.

- Review SLA requirements

notes.title: Project Doc 11
notes.content:
# PaymentProcessor Technical Overview

## Stack
Built on Redis, React, Kafka. Deployed to rag.

## Architecture
Uses Observability pattern. Sarah Kim designed the initial code review pipeline.

Integrates with NetOps Inc APIs via UserOnboarding.

Integrates with DataCo APIs via ConfigManager.

notes.title: Guide 19
notes.content:
# Terraform Best Practices

## Overview
Terraform is used across several projects including WorkflowEngine.

## Integration with Node.js
When combining Terraform with Node.js, follow the Clean Architecture patterns.

Elena Torres documented the documentation process.

When combining Docker with Kubernetes, follow the Clean Architecture patterns.

Carlos Rivera documented the code review process.
